commit_message:
Use integration-packaging project to build ODL Deb

Use docker container from integration-packaging project to build
OpenDaylight deb packages. This change introduce support for systemd
and is a part of uplifting plugin to Fuel 10.

Notice: to build plugin with more than one version of ODL
fuel-plugin-builder needs to be installed from sources, this change is
required: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/311031/

Change-Id: Ib6204c1fa71a844fe42b878352bd987c192ee9dd
Signed-off-by: Michal Skalski <mskalski@mirantis.com>
XCM:
deployment_scripts/puppet/modules/opendaylight/manifests/install.pp | Use integration-packaging project to build ODL Deb

Use docker container from integration-packaging project to build
OpenDaylight deb packages. This change introduce support for systemd
and is a part of uplifting plugin to Fuel 10.

Notice: to build plugin with more than one version of ODL
fuel-plugin-builder needs to be installed from sources, this change is
required: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/311031/

Change-Id: Ib6204c1fa71a844fe42b878352bd987c192ee9dd
Signed-off-by: Michal Skalski <mskalski@mirantis.com> | No Issue | No Summary

commit_message:
Uplift BGPVPN to Boron-SR1 and odl-netvirt feature

- Make the plugin use Boron SR1 when the bgpvpn features are used
- Make BGPVPN use the odl-netvirt feature
- Make EXPERIMENTAL_TARBALL_LOCATION point to SR1
- Remove the default gateway input for bgpvpn
- Unconditionally enable some features which were disabled for bgpvpn.
  Disable the bgpvpn specific environment configurations that were used
  in lieu of those features that were disabled for bgpvpn
- Make floating IP work for odl-netvirt-openstack. This is done by
  adding a provider_mapping to ovs between physnet1 and br-floating, which
  opendaylight uses to configure the networking setup accordingly.

Co-Authored-By: Romanos Skiadas <rski@intracom-telecom.com>
Change-Id: Icdb962dac83d0a68b25914285a0e7d8987daefdc
XCM:
deployment_scripts/puppet/manifests/odl-common_config.pp | Uplift BGPVPN to Boron-SR1 and odl-netvirt feature

- Make the plugin use Boron SR1 when the bgpvpn features are used
- Make BGPVPN use the odl-netvirt feature
- Make EXPERIMENTAL_TARBALL_LOCATION point to SR1
- Remove the default gateway input for bgpvpn
- Unconditionally enable some features which were disabled for bgpvpn.
  Disable the bgpvpn specific environment configurations that were used
  in lieu of those features that were disabled for bgpvpn
- Make floating IP work for odl-netvirt-openstack. This is done by
  adding a provider_mapping to ovs between physnet1 and br-floating, which
  opendaylight uses to configure the networking setup accordingly.

Co-Authored-By: Romanos Skiadas <rski@intracom-telecom.com>
Change-Id: Icdb962dac83d0a68b25914285a0e7d8987daefdc | No Issue | No Summary

Add firewall resource that opens BGP ports

connections to port 179.

commit_message:
Refactor api service management

Drop validation of service name which is not implemented for
the other daemons, to simplify handling of the provided service name.

This allows us to more easily offload the service name definition to
hiera data in the near future.

Change-Id: I179246eabd540e7c905d67eb3f99840809c99e4e
Signed-off-by: Takashi Kajinami <kajinamit@oss.nttdata.com>

the other daemons, to simplify handling of the provided service name.

This allows us to more easily offload the service name definition to
hiera data in the near future.

Change-Id: I179246eabd540e7c905d67eb3f99840809c99e4e

commit_message:
Refactor api service management

Drop validation of service name which is not implemented for
the other daemons, to simplify handling of the provided service name.

This allows us to more easily offload the service name definition to
hiera data in the near future.

Change-Id: I179246eabd540e7c905d67eb3f99840809c99e4e
Signed-off-by: Takashi Kajinami <kajinamit@oss.nttdata.com>

commit_message:
Remove /v3 suffix from auth url

This is no longer required in recent OpenStack where only identity v3
API is provided. The default value may not work in real production
environment so this may affect only small PoC use case with a single
node.

Change-Id: Id283608675a8d118c0bf86fc740ea8649444facb
Signed-off-by: Takashi Kajinami <kajinamit@oss.nttdata.com>
XCM:
manifests/service_credentials.pp | Remove /v3 suffix from auth url

This is no longer required in recent OpenStack where only identity v3
API is provided. The default value may not work in real production
environment so this may affect only small PoC use case with a single
node.

commit_message: Merge "Remove support for [oslo_messaging_rabbit] heartbeat_in_pthread"
XCM: manifests/init.pp | Merge "Remove support for [oslo_messaging_rabbit] heartbeat_in_pthread" | No Issue | No Summary

commit_message:
Remove support for [oslo_messaging_rabbit] heartbeat_in_pthread

Aodh does not use eventlet so this option has no effect.

The option was deprecated as part of community-wide effort to remove
eventlet.

Change-Id: Ifb4a7327495810e84b51e0845cd91b52b157cf7e
Signed-off-by: Takashi Kajinami <kajinamit@oss.nttdata.com>

commit_message: Merge "Replace wsgi script"
XCM: manifests/params.pp | Merge "Replace wsgi script" | No Issue | No Summary

commit_message:
Replace wsgi script

pbr is removing support for wsgi_script due to changes in setuptools.
Use the wsgi script module python code instead.

Note that this change only touches CentOS code. Ubuntu and Debian will
be updated later when we bump the release used in our testing.

Change-Id: I5b8b37c72eb687baea10cca2e63ca0231aa41d4e
Signed-off-by: Takashi Kajinami <kajinamit@oss.nttdata.com>
XCM:

commit_message:
Remove watch_log_file

The option was deprecated during the 2024.2 cycle[1]. Processes may
fail to start when it is set to True[2] so supporting it is no longer
useful.

[1] 31603ac6dacd0b47ec9f02d99bfdd0a7b683119c
[2] b977cb9becbeaaa67bb663bd8db5aa6846e495b9

Change-Id: Ife923bda0c1fe5dffa5f219c41ae743b8dcb7dd7
XCM:
manifests/logging.pp | Remove watch_log_file

The option was deprecated during the 2024.2 cycle[1]. Processes may
fail to start when it is set to True[2] so supporting it is no longer
useful.

[1] 31603ac6dacd0b47ec9f02d99bfdd0a7b683119c
[2] b977cb9becbeaaa67bb663bd8db5aa6846e495b9

Change-Id: Ife923bda0c1fe5dffa5f219c41ae743b8dcb7dd7 | No Issue | No Summary

commit_message:
Add a rabbit_transient_queues_ttl and amqp_auto_delete params

The amqp_auto_delete option needs this patch:
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/puppet-oslo/+/944132

Since transient_queues_ttl is also managed by oslo::messaging::rabbit,
there's no way to use aodh_config to set it, so this patch is
mandatory for one to set rabbit_transient_queues_ttl in aodh.conf.

Change-Id: I7153d5ac02e35c94693414f8c025dfa438475874
XCM:
manifests/init.pp | Add a rabbit_transient_queues_ttl and amqp_auto_delete params

The amqp_auto_delete option needs this patch:
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/puppet-oslo/+/944132

Since transient_queues_ttl is also managed by oslo::messaging::rabbit,
there's no way to use aodh_config to set it, so this patch is
mandatory for one to set rabbit_transient_queues_ttl in aodh.conf.

Change-Id: I7153d5ac02e35c94693414f8c025dfa438475874 | No Issue | No Summary

commit_message:
Support db schema upgrade

The rally db command provides the separate upgrade subcommand to
upgrade schema of existing database. This change provides the option to
use the upgrade command instead of the create command so that users can
use the sync class for schema upgrade.

Change-Id: I778381879c9aa6c790423262c90142a6b383c252
XCM:
manifests/db/sync.pp | Support db schema upgrade

The rally db command provides the separate upgrade subcommand to
upgrade schema of existing database. This change provides the option to
use the upgrade command instead of the create command so that users can
use the sync class for schema upgrade.

Change-Id: I778381879c9aa6c790423262c90142a6b383c252 | No Issue | No Summary

commit_message:
Replace outdated command to create rally db

The rally-manage db command was already replaced by the rally db
command[1]. This fixes the outdated command still used.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/rally/+/681224

Closes-Bug: #2002372
Change-Id: I34570e7c4131c3f06a1da23e9f2e57eec75ff25a
summary_issue:
The rally-manage db command was deprecated in favor of the rally db command in rally 0.10.0 and was already removed[1].
We should use the new command to create the rally db.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/rally/+/681224
XCM:
manifests/db/sync.pp | Replace outdated command to create rally db

The rally-manage db command was already replaced by the rally db
command[1]. This fixes the outdated command still used.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/rally/+/681224

Closes-Bug: #2002372
Change-Id: I34570e7c4131c3f06a1da23e9f2e57eec75ff25a | #2002372 | The rally-manage db command was deprecated in favor of the rally db command in rally 0.10.0 and was already removed[1].
We should use the new command to create the rally db.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/rally/+/681224

commit_message:
Manila: Allow tuning for access creation/deletion polling

This introduces support for a few tuning parameters which controls
polling checks while creating or deleting share access.

Change-Id: I47f98611201882c71ef781ed34cd43b80fffdbc0
XCM:
manifests/settings/manila.pp | Manila: Allow tuning for access creation/deletion polling

This introduces support for a few tuning parameters which controls
polling checks while creating or deleting share access.

commit_message:
Deprecate implementations for removed EC2 API tests

Support for EC2 API by rally was removed a long ago[1]. This formally
deprecates the remaining implementation so that we can remove these in
a next cycle.

commit_message:
CentOS: Install openstack plugin package

Currently plugins and jobs for OpenStack environment are not included
by the base rally package but these are provided by the independent
plugin package. This change ensures the plugin package is installed.

Note that the plugin package is not available in Ubuntu/Debian now so
the package is still missing in these distributions.

Closes-Bug: #1969113
Change-Id: I7b3b285f1cb298bbabae012862ae5dc1223bf602
summary_issue:
Currently all plugin implementation and job definition for OpenStack environment is not included by the base openstack-rally package and these are provided by the separate plugin package.
We should install the plugin package as well so that rally jobs for OpenStack environment can be executed.

Note at the time of writing, the plugin packae is not available in Ubuntu and Debian.
XCM:
manifests/init.pp | CentOS: Install openstack plugin package

Currently plugins and jobs for OpenStack environment are not included
by the base rally package but these are provided by the independent
plugin package. This change ensures the plugin package is installed.

Note that the plugin package is not available in Ubuntu/Debian now so
the package is still missing in these distributions.

Closes-Bug: #1969113

We should install the plugin package as well so that rally jobs for OpenStack environment can be executed.

Note at the time of writing, the plugin packae is not available in Ubuntu and Debian.

commit_message:
Import base parameter types for ::policy

Import the parameter types from openstacklib::policy so that parameter
types are validated at module level, instead of internal resource
call.

Also remove the tag which is no longer necessary after dependency
refactoring.

Change-Id: I3b762e4a0eb044c2995e4a5963a8ed3da2cb54c0
Signed-off-by: Takashi Kajinami <kajinamit@oss.nttdata.com>
XCM:

types are validated at module level, instead of internal resource
call.

Also remove the tag which is no longer necessary after dependency
refactoring.

Change-Id: I3b762e4a0eb044c2995e4a5963a8ed3da2cb54c0
Signed-off-by: Takashi Kajinami <kajinamit@oss.nttdata.com> | No Issue | No Summary

commit_message:
Refactor api service management

Drop validation of service name which is not implemented for
the other daemons, to simplify handling of the provided service name.

This allows us to more easily offload the service name definition to
hiera data in the near future.

Change-Id: Ib41ff01471217e02941991a11c71a846750b24f7
Signed-off-by: Takashi Kajinami <kajinamit@oss.nttdata.com>
XCM:
manifests/api.pp | Refactor api service management

Drop validation of service name which is not implemented for
the other daemons, to simplify handling of the provided service name.

This allows us to more easily offload the service name definition to
hiera data in the near future.

Change-Id: Ib41ff01471217e02941991a11c71a846750b24f7
Signed-off-by: Takashi Kajinami <kajinamit@oss.nttdata.com> | No Issue | No Summary

commit_message:
Refactor resource dependencies

This refactors resource dependencies to avoid unnecessary dependencies
across services. For example zaqar service does not require cinder db.

commit_message:
Use new openstackclient tag

The new openstackclient tag was added so that we can get all resources
about openstack CLI more easily. This adds this tag to watcherclient
because the package provides some sub-commands.

Also make sure openstackclient is installed so that the 'openstack'
command is available.

Change-Id: Ie078debd7f75fa4c677a0e7c229a3e651035e2fc
Signed-off-by: Takashi Kajinami <kajinamit@oss.nttdata.com>
XCM:
manifests/client.pp | Use new openstackclient tag

The new openstackclient tag was added so that we can get all resources
about openstack CLI more easily. This adds this tag to watcherclient
because the package provides some sub-commands.

Also make sure openstackclient is installed so that the 'openstack'
command is available.

Change-Id: Ie078debd7f75fa4c677a0e7c229a3e651035e2fc
Signed-off-by: Takashi Kajinami <kajinamit@oss.nttdata.com> | No Issue | No Summary

commit_message:
Remove support for [oslo_messaging_rabbit] heartbeat_in_pthread

discouraged now.

commit_message:
Add support for max_*_workers options

The [watcher_decision_engine] max_workers option was replaced by
separate options long time ago[1]. This adds support for the "new"
options so that users can set the appropriate limit.

Note that support for the removed max_workers option is kept now and
it will be deprecated separately, so that we can backport addition
of these new parameters.

[1] 2b6ee38327f70d749e71b81854c7b89cf9e69ac6

Change-Id: I128ccec0444ab7bd496001110a529cc24434af96
Signed-off-by: Takashi Kajinami <kajinamit@oss.nttdata.com>
XCM:

commit_message:
Replace wsgi script

pbr is removing support for wsgi_script due to changes in setuptools.
Use the wsgi script module python code instead.

Note that this change only touches CentOS code. Ubuntu and Debian will
be updated later when we bump the release used in our testing.

Change-Id: I96bb04d5862c9ae1790423da9b0d7c7a1aad8332
Signed-off-by: Takashi Kajinami <kajinamit@oss.nttdata.com>
XCM:
manifests/params.pp | Replace wsgi script

pbr is removing support for wsgi_script due to changes in setuptools.
Use the wsgi script module python code instead.

Note that this change only touches CentOS code. Ubuntu and Debian will
be updated later when we bump the release used in our testing.

Change-Id: I96bb04d5862c9ae1790423da9b0d7c7a1aad8332
Signed-off-by: Takashi Kajinami <kajinamit@oss.nttdata.com> | No Issue | No Summary

commit_message:
6wind-virtual-accelerator-plugin: implement security group deactivation

This patch reworks plugin to:

 - remove the possibility to disable ipset since starting from
   Virtual Accelerator 1.4 ipset are fully supported.

 - allow neutron security groups deactivation to benefit from better
   performances.

Disabling security groups needs (different) configurations on controller and
compute nodes. For this reason this patch moves all the node specific
neutron configuration in specific tasks for a better separation of code.

Signed-off-by: Francesco Santoro <francesco.santoro@6wind.com>
Closes-bug: #1631953

Change-Id: I030d41751811831144be0b640ae19e56f22a8f0b
summary_issue:
Fuel GUI does not make possible to disable security groups. This means that end-users need to manually edit neutron and nova configuration files to perform such setup.
In some scenarios security groups are not necessary and it should be possible to easily configure Fuel to disable them and benefit from the networking performances improvement.

compute nodes. For this reason this patch moves all the node specific
neutron configuration in specific tasks for a better separation of code.

Signed-off-by: Francesco Santoro <francesco.santoro@6wind.com>
Closes-bug: #1631953

commit_message:
6wind-virtual-accelerator-plugin: basic Fuel 9 support

This commit adds basic plugin support for Fuel 9.
In particular this patch should be considered a first version
since it does not leverage the new Fuel 9 NFV experimental
features.
Actually these NFV features have to be disabled to avoid
deployment failures.

Change-Id: Ie0beae198b2b3439c96741efd892b36961dd671e
Signed-off-by: Francesco Santoro <francesco.santoro@6wind.com>

since it does not leverage the new Fuel 9 NFV experimental
features.
Actually these NFV features have to be disabled to avoid
deployment failures.

Change-Id: Ie0beae198b2b3439c96741efd892b36961dd671e

commit_message:
6wind-virtual-accelerator-plugin: add support for multiple product version

This patch adds a field to define which version of 6WIND Virtual
Accelerator will be installed.
Moreover the default value now points to the last stable version thus we
need to make sure to disable ipset ONLY when using the Virtual
Accelerator 1.3.

Signed-off-by: Francesco Santoro <francesco.santoro@6wind.com>

Change-Id: Ia314535b520b4ac9e916a497366f075095d57335
XCM:
deployment_scripts/puppet/manifests/6wind_repo.pp | 6wind-virtual-accelerator-plugin: add support for multiple product version

This patch adds a field to define which version of 6WIND Virtual
Accelerator will be installed.
Moreover the default value now points to the last stable version thus we
need to make sure to disable ipset ONLY when using the Virtual
Accelerator 1.3.

Signed-off-by: Francesco Santoro <francesco.santoro@6wind.com>

Change-Id: Ia314535b520b4ac9e916a497366f075095d57335 | No Issue | No Summary

commit_message:
6wind-virtual-accelerator-plugin: workaround for ceilometer bug

When ceilometer is enabled on controller node and the plugin is active,
the environment deployment fails on the compute node hitting a bug similar
to https://bugs.launchpad.net/fuel/+bug/1603446.

More details available here:
https://github.com/openstack/fuel-library/blob/stable/8.0/deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/lib/facter/libvirt_package_version.rb
https://github.com/openstack/fuel-library/blob/stable/8.0/deployment/puppet/openstack/manifests/ceilometer.pp#L201

In particular the problem is visible when Fuel wants to add the ceilometer
user to the libvirt group. This group does not exist since the
libvirt package provided by 6WIND uses the libvirtd group instead.

With this patch the plugin simply creates an additional 'libvirt' group to
avoid command failures.

Signed-off-by: Francesco Santoro <francesco.santoro@6wind.com>

Change-Id: I463d15f470bf97dd028020f3c7ba9e8e49ac4cb5
XCM:
deployment_scripts/puppet/manifests/external_repo.pp | 6wind-virtual-accelerator-plugin: workaround for ceilometer bug

When ceilometer is enabled on controller node and the plugin is active,
the environment deployment fails on the compute node hitting a bug similar
to https://bugs.launchpad.net/fuel/+bug/1603446.

More details available here:
https://github.com/openstack/fuel-library/blob/stable/8.0/deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/lib/facter/libvirt_package_version.rb
https://github.com/openstack/fuel-library/blob/stable/8.0/deployment/puppet/openstack/manifests/ceilometer.pp#L201

In particular the problem is visible when Fuel wants to add the ceilometer
user to the libvirt group. This group does not exist since the
libvirt package provided by 6WIND uses the libvirtd group instead.

With this patch the plugin simply creates an additional 'libvirt' group to
avoid command failures.

Signed-off-by: Francesco Santoro <francesco.santoro@6wind.com>

Change-Id: I463d15f470bf97dd028020f3c7ba9e8e49ac4cb5 | No Issue | No Summary

commit_message:
fuel-plugin-virtual-accelerator: keep apparmor libvirt profile

This commit changes the hugepages mount point chosen by virtual accelerator
in order to use one authorized by apparmor for libvirt (/dev/hugepages).
Thanks to this patch we can now keep the apparmor libvirt profile.

Change-Id: I27eb4841f7e8350c234a0b11a28b363704bf22e9
Signed-off-by: Francesco Santoro <francesco.santoro@6wind.com>
XCM:
deployment_scripts/puppet/modules/virtual_accelerator/manifests/config.pp | fuel-plugin-virtual-accelerator: keep apparmor libvirt profile

This commit changes the hugepages mount point chosen by virtual accelerator
in order to use one authorized by apparmor for libvirt (/dev/hugepages).
Thanks to this patch we can now keep the apparmor libvirt profile.

Change-Id: I27eb4841f7e8350c234a0b11a28b363704bf22e9
Signed-off-by: Francesco Santoro <francesco.santoro@6wind.com> | No Issue | No Summary

commit_message:
6wind-virtual-accelerator-plugin: rework parameters displaying

With the 6WIND Virtual Accelerator 1.3.2 some advanced parameters have been
dismissed and the default value of others has changed.
This patch updates both these parameters in the Web UI and documentation.

Moreover the "License File" upload section has been moved to be always visible.

commit_message:
Remove support for [oslo_messaging_rabbit] heartbeat_in_pthread

This feature is known to break services using eventlet and is highly
discouraged now.

Change-Id: I04db4f346e2629218266355c88740243b28886cc
Signed-off-by: Takashi Kajinami <kajinamit@oss.nttdata.com>
XCM:
manifests/proxy/ceilometer.pp | Remove support for [oslo_messaging_rabbit] heartbeat_in_pthread

This feature is known to break services using eventlet and is highly
discouraged now.

Change-Id: I04db4f346e2629218266355c88740243b28886cc
Signed-off-by: Takashi Kajinami <kajinamit@oss.nttdata.com> | No Issue | No Summary

commit_message:
Switch to namespace sdtlib functions

puppetlabs-stdlib deprecated the existing functions in favor of
the new stdlib:: functions in 9.0.0. The version was released a few
years ago and now we assume we are ready to adopt to the migration.

Change-Id: I5369f25ddd0c985b6fc847d79ecdfeff12dacfff

commit_message:
Provide a flag that mark existence of provider network

Puppet provider does not detect presence of provider network
'admin_floating_net' and tries to create it on each deployment run.
Introduce flag that will mark that network exist.

commit_message:
Provide a flag that mark existence of provider network

Puppet provider does not detect presence of provider network
'admin_floating_net' and tries to create it on each deployment run.
Introduce flag that will mark that network exist.

Change-Id: Idf02399bef4cff4d9dcfa0f3f68f5e70466f4a87
Closes-bug: #1626927

Forcibly start openvswitch-switch

since we install STT enabled OVS.

commit_message:
Use default protection domain in nova according to SDS.

Each compute node is SDS. So, to balance ephemeral volumes between
domains it is needed to use default domain according to assigned domain
to the node.

Change-Id: I5b7eddd276bda42250ce8c26f6d3510e886a8e13
XCM:
deployment_scripts/puppet/manifests/nova.pp | Use default protection domain in nova according to SDS.

Each compute node is SDS. So, to balance ephemeral volumes between
domains it is needed to use default domain according to assigned domain
to the node.

Change-Id: I5b7eddd276bda42250ce8c26f6d3510e886a8e13 | No Issue | No Summary

commit_message:
Add support for MOS8 in fuel plumgrid plugin:
 - Changed parameters in environment config file
 - Changed values in metadata file
 - Changed director.pp manifest
    - Remove neutron-plugin package
    - Add support for deb based networking-plumgrid
      package
 - Changed core plugin value
 - Replace plugin name in guess function
 - Add iptables rule for metadata
 - Add support for solutions api (license, ips, zoneinfo)
 - Fixed cleanup script
 - Delete all neutron agents at deployment
 - Place nova sql url in nova.conf of compute
 - Add fabric network support in modules
 - Made username and password variable in post license
 - Setup plumgrid sigmund service
 - Indentation fixes

Ticket: [SOL-1022] [SOL-975] [SOL-782] [SOL-1147] [SOL-1144] [SOL-1101]

(cherry picked from commit 2bfe4490a78b1e422b999d1655b0cb9015fdc239)

 - Changed parameters in environment config file

commit_message:
zuul: add missing $host_ip variable to zuul-web class

follow-up to I2cc363dd9dd. the $host_ip variable is needed
and should not be empty as its used in the template for
the systemd unit.

Bug: T405119
Change-Id: Iacf7b02ed0fa7cb854f81ec4a4dd7f5fd5632070
summary_issue:
`zuul-web` serves the web dashboard to end users Communicates with Database, Zookeeper.

This will be a systemd unit using the zuul-web image: `docker-registry.wikimedia.org/repos/releng/zuul/zuul/zuul-web:wmf-12.0.0-5`

Per @Corvus in T395938#10929023:

Bind mounts for:
- `/etc/zuul`
- Zookeeper TLS certs (I think that's `/etc/cfssl`?)

And:
- Runs as the `zuul` user
- Listening on port 9000 for incoming connections (which is where apache on this host already wants to point)
XCM:
modules/profile/manifests/zuul/zuul_web.pp | zuul: add missing $host_ip variable to zuul-web class

follow-up to I2cc363dd9dd. the $host_ip variable is needed
and should not be empty as its used in the template for
the systemd unit.

Bug: T405119
Change-Id: Iacf7b02ed0fa7cb854f81ec4a4dd7f5fd5632070 | T405119 | `zuul-web` serves the web dashboard to end users Communicates with Database, Zookeeper.

This will be a systemd unit using the zuul-web image: `docker-registry.wikimedia.org/repos/releng/zuul/zuul/zuul-web:wmf-12.0.0-5`

Per @Corvus in T395938#10929023:

Bind mounts for:
- `/etc/zuul`
- Zookeeper TLS certs (I think that's `/etc/cfssl`?)

And:
- Runs as the `zuul` user
- Listening on port 9000 for incoming connections (which is where apache on this host already wants to point)

commit_message:
cyberbot: use wmflib::debian_php_version to pick PHP version

Fix existing FIXME. Nowadays we can use our custom fact from
wmflib to determine the correct PHP version for a Debian release.

The linked ticket is resolved since 2023.. though interestingly
it seems the last comments were more rejection than resolving.

Change-Id: Iebff304858a9c7850bdde99415326c89162a8183
XCM:
modules/profile/manifests/cyberbot/exec.pp | cyberbot: use wmflib::debian_php_version to pick PHP version

Fix existing FIXME. Nowadays we can use our custom fact from
wmflib to determine the correct PHP version for a Debian release.

The linked ticket is resolved since 2023.. though interestingly
it seems the last comments were more rejection than resolving.

Change-Id: Iebff304858a9c7850bdde99415326c89162a8183 | No Issue | No Summary

dse-k8s-worker2003: return to production role

This host reimaged cleanly, let's move it back to
a production role.

See also:
I08cc138d6d71cb2a35257980da25dff83b7de121

Hosts: dse-k8s-worker2003.codfw.wmnet
Bug: T399778
Change-Id: I95f60cb3a008566bf63389ea9d246ecc59611bbb
summary_issue:
This task will track the racking, setup, and OS installation of X

== Hostname / Racking / Installation Details ==

**Hostnames**: dse-k8s-worker2003 
**Racking Proposal**:  Any row except C or D (other dse-k8s-workers are in that row)
**Networking Setup:** 1x 10G on private VLAN
**OS Distro**: Bookworm (default unless otherwise specified)
**Boot Method:** UEFI
**Sub-team Technical Contact:** @bking (inflatador on IRC) or @BTullis (btullis on IRC)

== Per host setup checklist ==

==== dse-k8s-worker2003:
[x] Receive in system on #procurement task T399104 & in Coupa
[x] Rack system with proposed racking plan (see above) & update Netbox (include all system info plus location, state of planned)
[x] Run the [[ https://netbox.wikimedia.org/extras/scripts/provision_server.ProvisionServerNetwork/ |  Provision a server's network attributes ]] Netbox script - Note that you must run the DNS and Provision cookbook after completing this step
[x] **Immediately** run the `sre.dns.netbox` cookbook
[x] **Immediately** run the `sre.hosts.provision` cookbook
[] Run the `sre.hardware.upgrade-firmware` cookbook
[x] Update the `operations/puppet` repo - this should include updates to preseed.yaml, and site.pp with roles defined by service group: https://wikitech.wikimedia.org/wiki/SRE/Dc-operations
[] Run the `sre.hosts.reimage` cookbook

commit_message:
backups: Migrate Gerrit and GitLab backups to new storage hosts

The production jobs are getting overloaded and filled up with
new data. Split the jobs into the general storage jobs, keeping
the name "production", and the new, dedicated for code and
related repositories data (for Gerrit and Gitlab) storage "repos".

This is the final part of the migration, when we apply the new &
tested configuration to both services.

Bug: T403946
Change-Id: Ifdc78825b7834129d8238e9c1ec44eac27086b9c
summary_issue:
MariaDB backups were split into its own dedicated storage daemon host due to its frequency and size, plus the requirement of preprocessing to avoid blocking regular backups back in 2019.

Now that gitlab also requires some preprocessing, plus gerrit always had required a different profile (with hourly backups), as well as the increased needs in space for regular backups, it is the time to do the same for repository data.

Gitlab and gerrit backups should be migrated to a different available storage host.
XCM:
modules/profile/manifests/gerrit.pp | backups: Migrate Gerrit and GitLab backups to new storage hosts

new data. Split the jobs into the general storage jobs, keeping
the name "production", and the new, dedicated for code and
related repositories data (for Gerrit and Gitlab) storage "repos".

This is the final part of the migration, when we apply the new &
tested configuration to both services.

commit_message:
cloudceph: fix single-nic vlan interface specification

As far as 'ip' is concerned, the device is vlan<id>

Bug: T405478
Change-Id: Ie11cc8090ad60b658c387815fc79196ceeda8edf
summary_issue:
Following up from today's wmcs/network sync; it was decided to test-run a single NIC configuration for cloudcephosd. This is also a followup on {T399180}, to be noted that both NICs on cloudcephosd hosts have MTU 9000 since {T315446}.

The end state as far as this task is concerned is as such:

* One 25G NIC connected on cloudcephosd1050 and cloudcephosd1051
* On Linux the NIC will have untagged traffic on the main network, as everything else
* There will be a sub-interface on VLAN id XXX for the storage network
* IP addressing remains unchanged
XCM:
modules/profile/manifests/cloudceph/osd.pp | cloudceph: fix single-nic vlan interface specification

As far as 'ip' is concerned, the device is vlan<id>

commit_message:
Cloudcephosd1050: Configure ceph with a single nic

In dual-nic OSD nodes we have two nics specified in
profile::cloudceph::osd::hosts. For a single-nic host, we'll set up a
tagged interface, so profile::cloudceph::osd::hosts needs to tell us what
vlan to attach to.

Hosts: cloudcephosd1049.eqiad.wmnet
Hosts: cloudcephosd1050.eqiad.wmnet
Bug: T405478
Change-Id: Ie303aa06897480eeeb0bf75aeed84d071d8a695b

summary_issue:
A part of the effort to standardize failover procedures for Collab services.

[x] Figure out how many hosts we want running at a given time (2 or 3)
[x] Schedule a meeting with Antoine and Tyler / check for dependencies on the RelEng side
[x] Is the replica upgraded to the latest version?
[x] Test how long it’ll take to set up a host from scratch
[x] Test a failover
[x] Automate failover: {T260666}
[x] Test the automation
[x] Ensure Gerrit read-only plugin is available on all instances
[x] Simplify hiera lookup: https://gerrit.wikimedia.org/r/c/operations/puppet/+/1129920
[x] Dry run tests
[x] Prepare next switchover patches
[x] Prepare nftable throttling (T387833#11057848)
[x] Dry run switchover
[x] Schedule
[] Run 
  - Puppet Patch: [[ https://gerrit.wikimedia.org/r/c/operations/puppet/+/1193845 | operations/puppet/+/1193845 ]]
  - DNS Patch [[ https://gerrit.wikimedia.org/r/c/operations/dns/+/1193846 | operations/dns/+/1193846 ]]
[] re-enable backups ({T406762})
[] Ensure user migration is done ({T338470})
[] update the [[ https://wikitech.wikimedia.org/wiki/Gerrit/Operations#Switch_over | Wikitech process ]] with the new steps/nuances
[] Reimage gerrit1003.wikimedia.org + reenable replication
[] Reimage gerrit2002.wikimedia.org + reenable replication
